attributes.action: commission HM Treasury to compile a report listing all the publicly owned assets (i.e. whether properties, surplus equipment, any shares, any business etc) sold by successive British governments since 1980, detailing their location, nature and sale proceeds.  The petitioner also asks the Prime Minister to confirm (i) that none of the sale proceeds were used to fund government expenditure on revenue account; (ii) that none of the sale proceeds of assets located in, or related to England in any way, were used to benefit Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland; and (iii) that under the current devolution settlement to what extent publicly owned assets located in Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland are ‘the preserve’ of their devolved governments.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The people of England deserve to know whether the British government has been selling any of our nation’s ‘family silver’ and frittering away the sale proceeds either on day-to-day expenditure, or for the benefit of those who do not live in England.  


I think we will find that publicly owned assets located in Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland are ‘the preserve’ (word chosen carefully) of those devolved governments.

I fear we will find that England's national heritage has been ruthlessly asset-stripped to benefit others.
